examples.description: Generate a directive with the exported symbol matching the file name. It results in the directive `FooDirective` at `mylib/src/lib/foo.directive.ts`
Generate a directive without providing the file extension. It results in the directive `Foo` at `mylib/src/lib/foo.ts`
Generate a directive with a given type/suffix. It results in the directive `FooDirective` at `mylib/src/lib/foo.directive.ts`
Generate a directive with the exported symbol different from the file name. It results in the directive `Custom` at `mylib/src/lib/foo.ts`

path.description: The file path to the directive. Relative to the current working directory.
path.x-prompt: What is the directive file path?

name.description: The directive symbol name. Defaults to the last segment of the file path.

prefix.description: A prefix to apply to generated selectors.

skipTests.description: Do not create "spec.ts" test files for the new class.

skipImport.description: Do not import this directive into the owning NgModule.

selector.description: The HTML selector to use for this directive.

standalone.description: Whether the generated directive is standalone.

module.description: The filename of the declaring NgModule.

export.description: The declaring NgModule exports this directive.

type.description: Append a custom type to the directive's filename. It defaults to 'directive' for Angular versions below v20. For Angular v20 and above, no type is appended unless specified.
